citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
An environment enhancement plan to promote the psychological well-being of bird species at the facility was not available
for inspection. Exhibitor facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for environment
enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the facility's
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in Subpart G under the Animal Welfare Act (found
in USDA APHIS Animal Care's "Blue Book"). Also, the plan must be in accordance with currently accepted professional
standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. In order to ensure adequate overall welfare for
bird species, the facility must develop the plan, and must have it available to APHIS personnel upon request during
inspections.
To be corrected by: February 3, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with two facility representatives.
n

for inspection. Exhibitor facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate  plan for environment 
enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved  by the facility's

in USDA APHIS Animal Care's "Blue Book"). Also, the plan must be in accordance with currently accepted professional 
standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. In order to ensure adequate overall welfare for 
bird species, the facility must develop  the plan, and must have it available to APHIS personnel upon request during

To be corrected by: February 3, 2024
